title.narrative: Campaign for ratification of WASH and health facilities after Bihar floods 2015

description.narrative: 1: Identification of local volunteers and formation of WASH committee (50% male and 50% female) 2: Capacity building of WASH committee members about process of behavioral changing, process of water purification, personal hygiene, process of hand washing and public health etc. 3: Coordination with multi stake holders at each level 4: Regular sharing the progress with district administration, BIAG and BSDMA, Patna, Bihar 5: Learning and experiences sharing at district level in Purnea division 6: Conduct 16 health camps in most flooded areas with the support of health department 7: Development of various IEC materials on WASH, Health, SDRF, Prescription pad and Government schemes 8: Community mobilization activities such as Community meeting, Rally, wall writing, community mobilization song on WASH, Health, State disaster response fund and others rights 9: Arrangement of visibility materials for ensuring visibility through printed T shirt, Banners, pamphlet etc.

Proposed intervention will provide immediate WASH support in the form of hygiene promotion, water purification kits and tables in additional to repair of hand pumps and chlorinate the wells and water points. After the flood most of the water sources are either damaged or contaminated or both, people are living in open with no or limited sanitation facilities, it is important that they are informed of good hygiene practices to avoid disease. PGVS will work with government at district level to access local resources of chlorine tables, bleaching power, they will also add support received from CAFOD to make it joint intervention to address comprehensive WASH needs.
